key_points: Taliban advances closer to Kabul, with Mazar-i-Sharif and Jalalabad being the last major cities under government control.
People in Mazar experienced fear as the Taliban attacked the nearby district of Dehdadi.
Residents of Mazar-i-Sharif, an economic and cultural hub, alarmed by the Taliban's attacks.
Flight prices doubled and airports became overcrowded as people rushed to leave the affected areas.
ATMs ran out of money, and banks were overwhelmed as residents tried to withdraw cash.
The United States and the United Kingdom announced plans to send troops to secure Kabul airport for evacuations.
Flight prices to international destinations like Dubai and Istanbul skyrocketed due to the crisis.
Obtaining travel visas became increasingly difficult for Afghan citizens.
Panic and chaos were widespread at airports, with many unable to board their flights despite having tickets.
Concerns grow among those unable to leave about their fate under potential Taliban rule.
